title: patch font
content:
I see this style of font all the time on patches. Does anyone know of a font that has a similar look to it? Are fonts on stitching machines unique?

Similar would be great, don’t need exact.

comments.content:
A similar alternate may be almost any common, condensed sans serif.. :)  
_( Some examples.: ‘ [Alternate Gothic](http://web.archive.org/web/20060604065036/http:/www.veer.com/partner/link.aspx?i=1129&p=products/typedetail.aspx?image=EFT0000010)’, ‘News Gothic’ / ‘Trade Gothic’, ‘ [Noga](http://web.archive.org/web/20060604065036/http:/www.typografski.de/fontboutique/pages/e_fonts_noga.html)’.. )_

But, Sure, There could as well be custom types for stitching machines..

Dav

formlos, your suggestions are great. pattyfab, i looked at franklin but the curved letters, like o, s, c, etc. are elliptical, while I was looking for the flat sided style like on the patch.

thank you both
